message: Hey Alex, glad you could make it. I skimmed your resume—looks like you've bounced between robotics, ML, and testing roles. Can you give me a quick rundown of what you actually do day to day right now at Ridgeway Robotics?
Yeah, mostly data stuff. Pipelines, sensor data, making sure it gets where it needs to go. Some analysis too.
Got it. You mention owning end-to-end pipelines for production tests. What does “owning” that look like in practice? Are you coding, designing infra, coordinating teams?
A bit of all that. I set things up and keep them running. Write scripts, fix issues when they pop up.
Cool. I also saw the YOLOv8 project with 98% mAP. That's pretty high. What kind of objects were you detecting, and how did you measure that metric?
It was like UI elements from an aim trainer game. I just used the standard eval setup from YOLO, split the dataset, trained, and checked the numbers.
